author: Gary
title: The Rock of Ages Lighthouse as Seen From the Ferry to Isle Royale National Park
text:
The Rock of Ages Lighthouse as Seen From the Ferry to Isle Royale National Park 
Camera NIKON D300S Aperture f/4.5 Exposure Time 1/8000 
Isle Royale is one of the least visited national parks in the United States. This is due to the fact that it is an island in Lake Superior, and the ferries which visit the island are not near major metropolitan areas. It is also the only US national park outside of Alaska which shuts down in the winter. 
If you take the ferry to the park from Grand Portage, MN (which is the closest ferry port to the island) you will pass the Rock of Ages Lighthouse, which sits on an island no bigger than the lighthouse itself. Get My FREE 100 Page Travel Photography eBook! 
One Response to "The Rock of Ages Lighthouse as Seen From the Ferry to Isle Royale National Park" By Cassidy Barnett July 12, 2015 - 5:29 pm
